item.title: Insecureshop - Hardcoded Credentials
item.description: Identify username and password that is hardcoded in the app
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: Analyzing Malware packets using gopackets
item.description: Gopacket is a library developed by google that provides capabilities for decoding packets in Go language. Enables decoding of malware traffic packets easily.
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: RedLineStealer Information Stealer Analysis
item.description: Redline malware is an Information Stealer written in c# , targeting windows victims. It is used for gathering victims information ranging from cookies, credentials, Discord tokens
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: RemcosRat infection chain from excel with Macros
item.description: RemcosRAT is a Fileless multi-stage malware that is distributed through malicious macros in Excel files.
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: Return-Oriented Programming - Callme
item.description: Reliably make consecutive calls to imported functions. Use some new techniques and learn about the Procedure Linkage Table.
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: Return-Oriented Programming - Ret2csu
item.description: Learn a ROP technique that lets you populate useful calling convention registers like rdi, rsi and rdx even in an environment where gadgets are sparse.
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: Return-Oriented Programming - ret2win
item.description: ret2win means return here to win and it's recommended you start with this challenge. Visit the challenge page by clicking this card to learn more.
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: Return-Oriented Programming - Split
item.description: Combine elements from the ret2win challenge that have been split apart to beat this challenge. Learn how to use another tool whilst crafting a short ROP chain.
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: Return-Oriented Programming - Write4
item.description: Find and manipulate gadgets to construct an arbitrary write primitive, then use it to learn where and how to get your data into process memory.
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: Static Analysis of Malware Strings
item.description: Strings challenges contains an un-encrypted flag stored within the executable. When run, the program will output an MD5 hash of the flag but not the original. Can you extract the flag?
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: Reversing 8-bit Bytecode Virtual Machine
item.description: Can you figure out how the VM works and write your own to decrypt the flag?
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: Android Application Security Series - Part2
item.description: Firebase, Local Sqlite and AWS storage security weaknesses.
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)

item.title: Android Application Security Series- Part 1
item.description: Intents, Exported Activity, Resources and Weak Cryptographic Algorithms
item.author: thuri783@gmail.com (Thuri10)
